avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh wind slabs represent the main danger.
avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of a strong wind, avalanche prone wind slabs will form in the course of the day in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. In particular on wind-loaded slopes the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent as the day progresses. The fresh snow as well as the wind slabs are lying on the unfavourable surface of an old snowpack in all aspects. They can be released easily or naturally, in particular on extremely steep slopes.
Mostly the avalanches are medium-sized and can be released by a single winter sport participant. Caution is to be exercised at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.

In particular very steep slopes and base of rock walls: As a consequence of the new snow medium-sized loose snow avalanches are possible. In particular on shady slopes these can be released in the faceted old snow.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area 25 cm of snow, and up to 50 cm in some localities, will fall until late in the night above approximately 2000 m.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2200 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. The rain gave rise on Thursday to moistening of the snowpack below approximately 1900 m.
Below approximately 1800 m from a snow sport perspective, insufficient snow is lying. On steep sunny slopes below approximately 2500 m a little snow is lying.
The snowpack is not distinctly layered. Shady slopes: The snowpack consists of faceted crystals.

tendency.highlights: Gradual decrease in avalanche danger as a consequence of the light to moderate northwesterly wind.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Gradual increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of the strong northwesterly wind.
avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of a strong wind, wind slabs will form in the course of the day in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls, especially on extremely steep slopes. The fresh snow as well as the wind slabs are lying on the unfavourable surface of an old snowpack on shady slopes. They can be released. In particular in the regions neighbouring those that are subject to danger level 3 (considerable) the avalanche prone locations are more widespread.
Sometimes the avalanches are medium-sized and can be released by a single winter sport participant. Caution is to be exercised at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.

In particular very steep slopes and base of rock walls: As a consequence of the new snow small to medium-sized loose snow avalanches are possible. In particular on shady slopes these can be released in the faceted old snow.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area 10 cm of snow, and up to 20 cm in some localities, will fall until late in the night above approximately 2000 m. The rain gave rise on Thursday to moistening of the snowpack below approximately 1900 m.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2200 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. Below approximately 1800 m from a snow sport perspective, insufficient snow is lying. On steep sunny slopes below approximately 2500 m a little snow is lying.
The snowpack is not distinctly layered. Shady slopes: The snowpack consists of faceted crystals.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Slight increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of the moderate to strong northwesterly wind.
avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of a moderate to strong wind, small wind slabs will form in the course of the day in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls, especially on extremely steep slopes. The small quantity of fresh snow as well as the small wind slabs are lying on the unfavourable surface of an old snowpack on shady slopes. These can be released. In particular along the border with Switzerland the avalanche prone locations are a little more prevalent.
The avalanches are small and can be released by a single winter sport participant. Caution is to be exercised at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area 5 cm of snow will fall until late in the night above approximately 2000 m. The rain gave rise on Thursday to moistening of the snowpack below approximately 2000 m.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2200 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. Below approximately 1800 m from a snow sport perspective, insufficient snow is lying. On steep sunny slopes below approximately 2500 m a little snow is lying.
The snowpack is not distinctly layered. Shady slopes: The snowpack consists of faceted crystals.

regions.name: B - VALLI DI GRESSONEY, AYAS, CHAMPORCHER
